paper_abstract: In this article, we consider a Gaussian random field f (t) living on a compact set T subset of R-d and the computation of the tail probabilities P(integral(T) e(f(t)) dt > e(b)) as b -> infinity. We design asymptotically efficient importance sampling estimators for a general class of Holder continuous Gaussian random fields. In addition to the variance control, we also analyze the bias (relative to the interesting tail probabilities) caused by the discretization.
paper_title: Efficient Simulations for the Exponential Integrals of Holder Continuous Gaussian Random Fields
